sn42.8:1.6.pli: Yaṁbahulaṁ yaṁbahulaṁ viharati, tena tena nīyatī’ti.
sn42.8:1.6.en: You’re led on by what you usually live by.’

sn42.8:1.8.pli: “‘Yaṁbahulaṁ yaṁbahulañca, gāmaṇi, viharati, tena tena nīyati’, evaṁ sante na koci āpāyiko nerayiko bhavissati, yathā nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa vacanaṁ.
sn42.8:1.8.en: “‘You’re led on by what you usually live by’: if this were true, then, according to what Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta says, no-one would go to a place of loss, to hell.

sn42.8:2.4.pli: “‘Yaṁbahulaṁ yaṁbahulañca, gāmaṇi, viharati tena tena nīyatī’ti, evaṁ sante na koci āpāyiko nerayiko bhavissati, yathā nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa vacanaṁ.
sn42.8:2.4.en: “‘You’re led on by what you usually live by’: if this were true, then, according to what Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta says, no-one would go to a place of loss, to hell.

sn42.8:5.3.pli: “‘Yaṁbahulaṁ yaṁbahulañca, gāmaṇi, viharati tena tena nīyatī’ti, evaṁ sante na koci āpāyiko nerayiko bhavissati, yathā nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa vacanaṁ.
sn42.8:5.3.en: “‘You’re led on by what you usually live by’: if this were true, then, according to what Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta says, no-one would go to a place of loss, to hell.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 42.8
1. Chiefs
A Horn Blower

an10.71:2.1.pli: “Sampannasīlā, bhikkhave, viharatha sampannapātimokkhā, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesu.
an10.71:2.1.en: “Mendicants, live by the ethical precepts and the monastic code. Live restrained in the code of conduct, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.

an10.71:13.1.pli: ‘Sampannasīlā, bhikkhave, viharatha sampannapātimokkhā, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū’ti,
an10.71:13.1.en: ‘Live by the ethical precepts and the monastic code. Live restrained in the code of conduct, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.’

mlDocs.title:
Minor Collection
Sayings of the Dhamma 167–178
13. The World
Daharabhikkhuvatthu

dn26:21.15.pli: Yannūna mayaṁ pāṇātipātā virameyyāma, idaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ samādāya vatteyyāmā’ti.
dn26:21.15.en: Why don’t we refrain from killing living creatures? Having undertaken this skillful thing we’ll live by it.’

dn26:22.16.pli: yannūna mayaṁ matteyyā assāma petteyyā sāmaññā brahmaññā kule jeṭṭhāpacāyino, idaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ samādāya vatteyyāmā’ti.
dn26:22.16.en: Why don’t we pay due respect to mother and father, ascetics and brahmins, honoring the elders in our families? Having undertaken this skillful thing we’ll live by it.’

mlDocs.title:
So It Was Said 111
The Book of the Fours
The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
Accomplishment in Ethics

dn27:25.2.pli: Luddācārā khuddācārāti kho, vāseṭṭha, ‘suddā, suddā’ tveva akkharaṁ upanibbattaṁ.
dn27:25.2.en: ‘They live by hunting and menial tasks’ is the meaning of ‘worker’, the term specifically invented for them.
